rit.contoken
Class StatusMessage

java.lang.Object
  rit.contoken.StatusMessage

public class StatusMessage
extends java.lang.Object

An object that binded the operation status (databsse query or I/O) and the operation's result (an output or an error message)

Version:
1.0 Build 001 Sep 1, 2011.
Author:
Prach Chaisatien

Field Summary
 java.lang.String msg
          Operation result message contains the output or the error message of the operation
 boolean succeed
          Operation status indicator succeed == true indicates that the operation was successful succeed == false indicates that the operation was failed
 
Constructor Summary
StatusMessage()
          Default Constructor
StatusMessage(boolean succeed, java.lang.String msg)
          Constructor with succeed and msg argument
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String toJSON()
          create JSON message from StatusMessage status in JSON object is succeed or failed, imply from true or false of succeed attribute

equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Field Detail

succeed

public boolean succeed
Operation status indicator
  • succeed == true indicates that the operation was successful
  • succeed == false indicates that the operation was failed

    • msg

    public java.lang.String msg
    Operation result message contains the output or the error message of the operation

    Method Detail

    toJSON

    public java.lang.String toJSON()
    create JSON message from StatusMessage status in JSON object is succeed or failed, imply from true or false of succeed attribute

    Returns:
    JSON string of the StatusMessage
  • example 1: {status: "succeed", msg:"foo baa"}
  • example 2: {status: "failed", msg:"foo baa"}
